intro: Placus zollingeriana, commonly known as the Zollinger's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
